intro: Reidmorania occidentalis, commonly known as the Western Reedmorania, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces showy, pale yellow or white blooms during the dry season. Reidmorania occidentalis is often found in savanna habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its environment.
